#########################################################################
model{
	# Truco de los ceros
	for (i in 1:N){
		y[i] ~ dweib(alphaY,bY)
	}
	# Aprioris PM10
	alphaY ~  dunif(0,10)
	bY ~ dunif(0,10)
	# Estimaciones derivadas
	kY <- pow(bY, -1/alphaY)
}

data
list(y=c(287, 248, 241, 360, 380, 132, 131, 107, 124, 286, 192, 213, 380, 248, 311, 247, 212, 311, 283, 134, 171, 126, 222, 311, 346, 445, 884, 296, 303, 172, 239, 299, 226, 245, 299, 297, 124, 360, 253, 281, 438, 343, 241, 142, 110, 125, 148, 227, 221, 377, 498, 391, 319, 216, 89, 106, 102, 189, 160, 200, 208, 350, 571, 584, 304, 257, 245, 198, 127, 324, 328, 295, 292, 439, 300, 554, 312, 276, 159, 172, 105, 175, 183, 313, 391, 327, 227, 277, 384, 156, 104, 127, 102, 122, 141, 215, 265, 366, 270, 332, 408, 281, 406, 198, 195, 148, 169, 312, 235, 192, 569, 183, 193, 176, 220, 175, 150, 233, 256, 252, 312, 355, 278, 359, 399, 251, 174, 124, 131, 155, 162, 219, 454, 248, 599, 576, 212, 139, 132, 127, 120, 100, 100, 171, 258, 147, 172, 203, 168, 155, 103, 112, 98, 125, 197, 201, 251, 244, 337, 278, 260, 208, 143, 99, 117, 122, 153, 310, 214, 266, 256, 315, 220, 234, 134, 125, 106, 124, 182, 186, 273, 112, 277, 216, 377, 187, 151, 135, 279, 309, 277, 259, 299, 272, 496, 603, 307, 364, 112, 161, 102, 187, 173, 178, 258, 146, 388, 159, 222, 159, 149, 104, 173, 144, 175, 441, 211, 283, 420, 209, 321, 143, 158, 110, 103, 135, 156, 176, 191, 161, 201, 152, 148, 117, 110, 81, 83, 128, 167, 236, 196, 153, 240, 202, 141, 149, 127, 99, 102, 126, 185, 158, 168, 259, 96, 114, 131, 191, 92, 82, 85, 80, 116, 121, 187, 130, 132, 169, 205, 99, 97, 91, 88, 109, 114, 203, 148, 136, 137, 123, 85, 187, 121, 76, 81, 86, 109, 179, 192, 147, 119, 169, 217, 91, 99, 124, 84, 83, 98, 145, 200, 114, 288, 192, 135, 94, 71, 66, 82, 76, 197, 119, 417, 114, 372, 137, 266, 69, 124, 91, 70, 77, 118, 170), N=324)

inits
list(alphaY=3.31, bY=6.43E-7)
